result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to Probation while on Probation. May be deducted from prison wages. If not paid by end of Probation may be reduced to a civil judgment on behalf of the respective agency without court order.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.
No drugs. Cannot vote or hold elective office. If not a U.S. Citizen may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights until restored.

Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion. Must provide a DNA sample, no surcharge.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.

supervisions.notes: Follow through with all supervision recommendations.
